sourcing.instructions: Ag: Purchase from a metal supplier or online retailer, Cd: Obtain from a chemical supply company, Er: Source from a rare earth metals supplier, Ni: Available from hardware stores or metal suppliers, Y: Purchase from a chemical supplier specializing in rare earth elements.
steps: Ag: Purchase from a metal supplier or online retailer, Cd: Obtain from a chemical supply company, Er: Source from a rare earth metals supplier, Ni: Available from hardware stores or metal suppliers, Y: Purchase from a chemical supplier specializing in rare earth elements.

1. Weigh out each ingredient using a precise digital scale. 2. In a clean mixing bowl, combine Ag, Cd, Er, Ni, and Y in the order listed. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly for 10 minutes using a non-reactive spatula to ensure uniform distribution of all components. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a clean, high-temperature resistant crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out each ingredient using a precise digital scale. 2. In a clean mixing bowl, combine Ag, Cd, Er, Ni, and Y in the order listed. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly for 10 minutes using a non-reactive spatula to ensure uniform distribution of all components. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a clean, high-temperature resistant crucible.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the crucible in the furnace and hold at this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation. 3. Monitor the temperature using a thermocouple to maintain accuracy.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the crucible in the furnace and hold at this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation. 3. Monitor the temperature using a thermocouple to maintain accuracy.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and carefully extract the solid alloy. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the alloy into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces using progressively finer grits of sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and carefully extract the solid alloy. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the alloy into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces using progressively finer grits of sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface durability.
